amendment.description: Amendment reduces the appropriation for the Forest Service by $42 million in order to eliminate funding for construction of new timber logging roads in fiscal year 1997. \ Amendment subsequently failed on a separate vote in the full House. See Roll No. 266.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 18 in the Congressional Record of June 18, 1996, to eliminat the $42 million in funds appropriated in the bill for the Forest Service for construction of new timber logging roads in fiscal year 1997.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A012) Agreed to by recorded vote: 211 - 210 (Roll no. 258).

action.text: Mr. Kolbe demanded a separate vote on the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A012).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A012) Failed by recorded vote: 211 - 211 (Roll no. 266).
